page.title: 02General Landscape View
page.content: The country_side has lots of woods because of the many streams and rivers. The pastures are also good due to this important factor. The main river is the {* Western Cleddau * flowing from north to south to the local sea; all streams from nearby flow into it. There is a stream, river or spring in every area; many of the springs are near old farms _ only one is not _ it is near a { * Rath * The hedges here grow very high and it is very useful because of the prevailing sea winds. The hedges and banks are different from anywhere else (except in some parts of Ireland)..... a mound is made from stones and earth, then the hedges are planted on top.... they are Craftsmens' work & are called { * Pembrokeshire Stone & Turf Banks *
